# popoverShouldDetach(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a popover should detach from its positioning view and become a separate window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func popoverShouldDetach(_ popover: NSPopover) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **popover**: The popover that may be detached.

## Discussion

If you don’t implement this method, it returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] by default. If you return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] from this method, but you don’t implement [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopoverDelegate/detachableWindow(for:)] or you implement it to return `nil`, a detachable window is created with the popover’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/contentViewController].

An automatically created window has the same appearance as the detached popover. For example, if the popover’s [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/contentViewController] has a title, it will be bound to and displayed as the title of the detached window. When a popover is released in a detached state, it calls [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopoverDelegate/popoverDidDetach(_:)] on the delegate. When a detached popover is closed, calls to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopoverDelegate/popoverShouldClose(_:)], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopoverDelegate/popoverWillClose(_:)], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopoverDelegate/popoverDidClose(_:)], in addition to the related notifications, specify the reason [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSPopover/CloseReason/standard].

## Popover Visibility

- **popoverShouldClose(_:)**: Allows a delegate to override a close request.
- **popoverWillShow(_:)**: Invoked when the popover will show.
- **popoverDidShow(_:)**: Invoked when the popover has been shown.
- **popoverWillClose(_:)**: Invoked when the popover is about to close.
- **popoverDidClose(_:)**: Invoked when the popover did close.
- **popoverDidDetach(_:)**: Indicates that a popover has been released while it’s in an implicitly detached state.
